Setting Access Rights: Generic Instructions

Here are general instructions on how to set access rights for projects, views, folders, items, and components.

To set access rights:

  1. Select the object or item for which you wish to set rights.

    • To set project access rights, the project must be open to any view.

    • To set view access rights, the specific view must be open.

    • To set folder access rights, select the folder from the left pane.

    • To set an item’s access rights, select the item from the upper pane.

    • To set a component's access rights, click the component tab from the upper pane.

  2. Select Access Rights from the correct menu or context menu.

    • For project-level access rights, select Project > Access Rights from the menu bar.

    • For view-level access rights, select View > Access Rights from the menu bar.

    • For folder-level access rights, select Folder > Advanced > Access Rights from the menu bar.

    • For item-level access rights, select <item> > Advanced > Access Rights from the menu bar.

    • For component-level rights, select <item> > Advanced > Component Access Rights from the menu bar.

    These actions display an Access Rights dialog.

  3. Select the node for which you wish to specify access rights.

  4. From the Access Rights dialog, click Add to add a user or group. The Assign Access Rights To dialog opens.

  5. Select a user or group. Users are listed by their user names and groups are listed by their position in the group hierarchy, except for the All Users group.

  6. Select the Grant option button. Note: Never select the Deny option button unless you are creating an exception. See Setting Access Rights Exceptions.

  7. Click OK to return to the Access Rights dialog.

  8. Select and/or clear the appropriate check boxes for the user or group.

  9. Click OK when you are done.

Notes: See also Granting Server-Level Access Rights and Granting Access Rights for Individual Filters and Queries.
